title: The Threshold of Death and Perceptions Beyond Reality.
first_phrase: The following text delves into the mysterious phenomena that occur during experiments at the threshold of death, where individuals overcome the fear of vertigo, leading to lucidity and the ability to explore new realities. The author describes that those who reach this point can cross over to another mode of being, leaving their physical bodies in a state of apparent death and regaining consciousness in a primitive state.  In the last 200 tokens, the author describes how the sensation of vertigo transforms into curiosity when consciousness is separated from the body, and how individuals can perceive their surroundings differently, such as being able to increase or decrease what they see at will. The author ponders the existential question of whether one truly exists in these states of being.
content: El vértigo– que a menudo es causa de pánico en una voluntad débil, pánico que puede ser obstáculo para un posterior perfeccionamiento puede también ser causa de una brecha completa, y por lo tanto de la muerte – fácilmente se cambia en una extraña y casi divertida curiosidad cuando la consciencia, separada del cuerpo, casi suspendida en el aire en una habitación, tiene la percepción segura y controlable por si de las nuevas situaciones en las cuales se encuentra, sabe ver, sino sintiendo de no tener los ojos, es decir lo que lo circunda, por una maravilla de las maravillas, puede aumentar o disminuir a voluntad; y así contemplar el cuerpo, distendido e inerte, y decirse: yo soy aquel, pero no soy; soy y no soy en el mismo tiempo, o no soy en absoluto?
last_phrase: In conclusion, while the experience of vertigo and out-of-body consciousness can be both terrifying and exhilarating, it is beyond the realm of common understanding and communication. Rather than attempt to describe or analyze it, we can appreciate it as a wondrous mystery of the human mind. As Dante said, "let us leave the heights of imagination behind," and simply marvel at the complexities of our existence.
